What are effective risk mitigation practices for emerging diseases? In laboratory research and high-risk manufacturing environments, risk mitigation relies on multiple safety measures including engineering controls to establish barriers between the hazard and humans, administrative controls that guide best practices for handling hazards, and personal protective equipment (PPE) considered to be the personal protection of last resort when engineering or administrative control measures fail. When working with radioactivity the ALARA principle is applied, which means to keep the exposure As Low As Reasonably Achievable. Redundant measures are operationalized in healthcare settings and could be expanded to the larger public health community.
